revised_title: Electrical Activity and Feeding Mechanisms in Pleurobrachia Ctenophore
tldr: The study investigates the electrical activity and feeding mechanisms in the ctenophore Pleurobrachia. The researchers discovered two distinct classes of electrical activity in comb plates: excitatory postsynaptic potentials (EPSPs) in comb plate cells and regenerative potentials in cilia. They found that several conduction pathways are present to control electrical and motor activities during feeding. A localized pacemaker drives oscillatory neuronal activity in the ectodermal pathway innervating polster cells.
